data.title: New Orleans Pelicans Roster
data.meta_description: New Orleans Pelicans scores, news, schedule, players, stats, rumors, depth charts and more on RealGM.com
data.text:
2025 first round draft pick from L.A. Lakers

L.A. Lakers' 2025 1st round pick to New Orleans [L.A. Lakers-New Orleans-Washington, 7/6/2019]

2025 first round draft pick from Milwaukee

Milwaukee's 2025 1st round pick to New Orleans protected for selections 5-30 or to New York protected for selections 1-4 (Milwaukee's obligation to New Orleans or New York will thereafter be extinguished) (via New Orleans to Portland to Detroit to New York) [Denver-Milwaukee-New Orleans-Oklahoma City, 11/23/2020; New Orleans-Portland, 2/8/2022; Detroit-Portland, 7/6/2022; Detroit-New York, 7/6/2022]

2026 first round draft pick from Milwaukee (swap, New Orleans outgoing)

New Orleans has the right to swap its 2026 1st round pick for Milwaukee's 2026 1st round pick [Denver-Milwaukee-New Orleans-Oklahoma City, 11/23/2020]

2027 first round draft pick from Milwaukee

Milwaukee's 2027 1st round pick to New Orleans [Denver-Milwaukee-New Orleans-Oklahoma City, 11/23/2020]

2025 second round draft pick to San Antonio

New Orleans' 2025 2nd round pick to San Antonio (via Memphis to Phoenix) [Charlotte-Memphis-New Orleans, 8/7/2021; Memphis-Phoenix, 7/11/2023; Phoenix-San Antonio, 7/17/2023]

2026 second round draft pick to Boston, San Antonio or Washington

Boston will receive the most favorable of Minnesota's 2026 2nd round pick, New York's 2026 2nd round pick, New Orleans' 2026 2nd round pick and Portland's 2026 2nd round pick; New York will receive the less favorable of its pick and the Minnesota pick; San Antonio will receive the less favorable of the New Orleans pick and the Portland pick; Washington will receive the less favorable of (i) the more favorable of the Minnesota pick and the New York pick and (ii) the more favorable of the New Orleans pick and the Portland pick (via Minnesota to New York; via New Orleans to Portland to New Orleans; via Portland to Detroit; via New Orleans to San Antonio; via Detroit to Boston; via Detroit to Washington) [Minnesota-New York, 11/24/2020; New Orleans-Portland, 7/30/2021; New Orleans-Portland, 2/8/2022; Detroit-Portland, 7/6/2022; Detroit-New York, 7/11/2022; New Orleans-San Antonio, 2/9/2023; Boston-Detroit, 6/28/2023; Detroit-Washington, 1/14/2024]

2027 second round draft pick to Charlotte or Portland

Charlotte will receive the more favorable of Portland's 2027 2nd round pick and New Orleans' 2027 2nd round pick and Portland will receive the less favorable of the two; Portland may convey the pick it receives to Boston (see Portland Outgoing) (via New Orleans to Portland) [New Orleans-Portland, 2/8/2022; Charlotte-Philadelphia-Portland-New York, 2/9/2023]

2028 second round draft pick to San Antonio

New Orleans' 2028 2nd round pick to San Antonio [New Orleans-San Antonio, 2/9/2023]

2029 second round draft pick to San Antonio

New Orleans' 2029 2nd round pick to San Antonio [New Orleans-San Antonio, 2/9/2023]

Jordan Hawkins was selected as the #14 pick in the First Round of the 2023 NBA Draft by the New Orleans Pelicans. Jordan Hawkins signed a multi-year contract with the New Orleans Pelicans on July 3, 2023.

Herb Jones was selected as the #5 pick in the Second Round of the 2021 NBA Draft by the New Orleans Pelicans. Herb Jones signed a multi-year contract with the New Orleans Pelicans on August 16, 2021. Herb Jones re-signed to a multi-year contract as a free agent with the New Orleans Pelicans on July 6, 2023.

Karlo Matkovic was selected as the #22 pick in the Second Round of the 2022 NBA Draft by the New Orleans Pelicans. Karlo Matkovic signed a multi-year contract with the New Orleans Pelicans on July 13, 2024.

Yves Missi was selected as the #21 pick in the First Round of the 2024 NBA Draft by the New Orleans Pelicans. Yves Missi signed a multi-year contract with the New Orleans Pelicans on July 8, 2024.

Zion Williamson was selected as the #1 pick in the First Round of the 2019 NBA Draft by the New Orleans Pelicans. Zion Williamson signed a multi-year contract with the New Orleans Pelicans on July 1, 2019. Zion Williamson signed a multi-year extension with the New Orleans Pelicans on July 6, 2022.

Brandon Ingram was acquired in a trade by the New Orleans Pelicans from the Los Angeles Lakers on July 6, 2019. Brandon Ingram re-signed to a multi-year contract as a free agent with the New Orleans Pelicans on November 28, 2020.

C.J. McCollum was acquired in a trade by the New Orleans Pelicans from the Portland Trail Blazers on February 8, 2022. C.J. McCollum signed a multi-year extension with the New Orleans Pelicans on September 26, 2022.

Dejounte Murray was acquired in a trade by the New Orleans Pelicans from the Atlanta Hawks on July 6, 2024.
